thread.title: To Contain Deficit, Fix Social Security First

author: wsjcom
title: To Contain Deficit, Fix Social Security First
text: One of Martin Feldstein’s recommendations for reducing the deficit is to increase the full retirement age for collecting Social Security benefits (“Reagan’s Cure for America’s Debt Disease,” op-ed, March 6). If that is a viable solution because people are living longer, shouldn’t the required minimum distribution age for IRA distributions be raised in a like manner? This would allow people in retirement to keep more of their own funds in a tax-deferred environment for a longer time, which may help to offset the proposed loss of Social Security benefits.
